definition: the Ming (1368-1644) and Qing (1644-1911) dynasties
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Types existed in personage's image-building in the novels of the Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 明清講史小說在人物形象塑造上存在着類型化傾向。

sentences.english: Chapter Three focuses on the development of the person painting after The Ming dynasty and The Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第三章具體分析明清以後人物畫的發展趨勢和狀況。

sentences.english: After the romance of the Ming and Qing novel, the ghost town appears more mystery to people.
sentences.chinese: 經明清小說的渲染，豐都鬼城更加神祕怪誕。

sentences.english: Curing parents by cutting thigh is the common topic to promote filial piety in the dramas of the Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 割股療親是明清戲曲宣傳孝道的常用題材。

sentences.english: At the turn of the Ming and Qing Dynasties, because transportation prosperity brought Liaocheng cultural development.
sentences.chinese: 明清之交，由於漕運興盛帶來了聊城文化事業的發展。

sentences.english: Beijing, the Ming and Qing emperors on the altar is the place on Festival.
sentences.chinese: 北京的月壇就是明清皇帝祭月的地方。

sentences.english: Officials in Ming and Qing Dynasties were often sent to Qingshuijiang-Miao territory to collect timbers for royal palaces.
sentences.chinese: 明清兩朝爲修建皇宮到清水江“苗疆”徵辦“皇木”。

sentences.english: The Ming-Qing Period is a critical transitional period of Bai culture.
sentences.chinese: 明清時期，是白族文化發生重大轉型的關鍵時期。

sentences.english: In its long history, particularly in Ming and Qing dynasty the village had relatively developed economy.
sentences.chinese: 唐模村歷史上，特別是明清時期經濟發達。

sentences.english: The Eight-part essay was one of the special styles for the Imperial Examination from Ming to Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 八股文是明清科舉考試最基本也是最重要的一種文體。

sentences.english: The fusion of the three had become mature by the time of Ming and Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 到了明清時期，三教的融合已臻至成熱。

sentences.english: The second part is about the Special Dalits in Ming and Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，明清社會的特殊型賤民。

sentences.english: We specialized in the Ming and Qing Dynasties classical and modern furniture repair antique furniture production.
sentences.chinese: 我們專業從事明清古典傢俱修復和現代仿古傢俱製作。

sentences.english: Different inns display general character in management. First, they are gradational.
sentences.chinese: 明清時期不同種類的客店在經營中表現出一定的共性。

sentences.english: It was first introduced during the Ming and Qing dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 最早始於明清之際，當時稱洋畫。

sentences.english: Traders from Xiamen, in Fujian, used this type of ship for trading in the Ming and Qing dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 福建廈門的商人在明清兩代利用這些船隻進行貿易。

definition: the Ming dynasty (1368-1644)
the Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Song dynasty (960-1279)
the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
the Tang (618-907) and Song (960-1279) dynasties
the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
the Song dynasty (960-1279)/refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)
Sui (581-617) and Tang dynasties (618-907)
late Ming and early Qing/around the middle of the 17th century
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
the final years of the Ch'ing or Qing dynasty/China at the turn of the 20th century
the Qin (221-207 BC) and Han (206 BC-220 AD) dynasties
late Ming/first half of the 17th century
Six Dynasties (220-589)
the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
